content.question: The first derivative of the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="f prime of x, equals, x times, e raised to the sine x power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.05em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. How many points of inflection does the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have on the interval <math alttext="negative 3 less than x, less than 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
